name: GAD7
title: Generalized anxiety disorder 7 item (GAD-7)
description: The **Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment** (GAD-7) is a seven-item instrument that is used to measure or assess the severity of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD). Each item asks the individual to rate the severity of his or her symptoms over the past two weeks.</br></br>These questions are to be answered by the **patient**. Reference: [https://www.mdcalc.com/calc/1727/gad7-general-anxiety-disorder7](https://www.mdcalc.com/calc/1727/gad7-general-anxiety-disorder7).

code.display: Generalized anxiety disorder 7 item (GAD-7)

extension.valueString:
The Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) is a seven-item instrument that is used to measure or assess the severity of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD). Each item asks the individual to rate the severity of his or her symptoms over the past two weeks.

These questions are to be answered by the patient.

code.display: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by feeling nervous, anxious or on edge?

item.text: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by feeling nervous, anxious or on edge?

item.text: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by worrying too much about different things?

code.display: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by trouble relaxing?

item.text: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by trouble relaxing?

code.display: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by being so restless that it is hard to sit still?

item.text: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by being so restless that it is hard to sit still?

code.display: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by becoming easily annoyed or irritable?

item.text: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by becoming easily annoyed or irritable?

code.display: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by feeling afraid as if something awful might happen?

item.text: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by feeling afraid as if something awful might happen?

item.text: How difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?
If you checked off any problems on this questionnaire

code.display: Patient health questionnaire 9 item total score

item.text: Patient health questionnaire 9 item total score

The PHQ-9 is the standard (and most commonly used) depression measure, and it ranges from 0-27 Scoring: Add up all checked boxes on PHQ-9. For every check: Not at all = 0; Several days = 1; More than half the days = 2; Nearly every day = 3 (the scores are the codes that appear in the answer list for each of the PHQ-9 problem panel terms). Interpretation: 1-4 = Minimal depression; 5-9 = Mild depression; 10-14 = Moderate depression; 15-19 = Moderately severe depression; 20-27 = Severed depression.

title: Patient-reported Treatments Questionnaire
description: This questionnaire is completed by the patient in PainTracker; it allows them to self-report the number of healthcare and other service providers the patient has seen, treatments they've received, and the self-reported effectiveness of their treatments.

item.text: Number of healthcare providers seen for pain past 6 months
General Practice physicians (e.g., family medicine, internal medicine)
Medical Specialists (e.g., rheumatologist, allergy specialist, immunologist)
Pain Specialists
Surgical Specialists
Number of healthcare providers seen for pain past 6 months
Psychologists, Psychiatrists and other mental health professionals
Physical Therapists
Complementary and Alternative healthcare professionals (e.g., naturopath, massage therapist, accupuncutrist)
Efficacy of pain treatments in last 6 months
Exercise, physical therapy or occupational therapy?

valueCoding.display: Did not have this type of treatment

item.text: Physical modalities such as heat, massage, or TENS?

valueCoding.display: Did not have this type of treatment

item.text: Any behavioral treatment such as cognitive behavioral therapy, distraction, or relaxation?

valueCoding.display: Did not have this type of treatment

item.text: Efficacy of pain treatments in last 6 months

Non-opioid medications such as non-steroidal anti-inflammatory medications (like Motrin, Advil, ibuprofen, Celebrex) or “neuropathic pain medications” (like Neurontin, Lyrica, Cymbalta, other anti- depressant)?

valueCoding.display: Did not have this type of treatment

item.text: Alternative therapies such as acupuncture, hypnosis, yoga or meditation?

name: The Primary Care PTSD Screen for DSM-5 [PC-PTSD-5]
title: The Primary Care PTSD Screen for DSM-5 [PC-PTSD-5]
description: The Primary Care PTSD Screen for DSM-5 (PC-PTSD-5). Reference: [https://www.ptsd.va.gov/professional/assessment/screens/pc-ptsd.asp ](https://www.ptsd.va.gov/professional/assessment/screens/pc-ptsd.asp)

code.display: The Primary Care PTSD Screen for DSM-5 [PC-PTSD-5]

extension.valueString:
Sometimes things happen to people that are unusually or especially frightening, horrible, or traumatic. For example:
  • a serious accident or fire
  • a physical or sexual assault or abuse
  • an earthquake or flood
  • a war
  • seeing someone be killed or seriously injured
  • having a loved one die through homicide or suicide

item.text: Have you ever experienced this kind of event?
In the past month, have you had nightmares about the event(s) or thought about the event(s) when you did not want to?
In the past month, have you tried hard not to think about the event(s) or went out of your way to avoid situations that reminded you of the event(s)?
In the past month, have you been constantly on guard, watchful, or easily startled?
In the past month have you felt numb or detached from people, activities, or your surroundings?
In the past month have you felt guilty or unable to stop blaming yourself or others for the event(s) or any problems the event(s) may have caused?

code.display: PC-PTSD-5 score

item.text: PC-PTSD-5 score

code.display: Patient health questionnaire 4 item total score

item.text: Patient health questionnaire 4 item total score

The PHQ-4 is different -- although the total score (which ranges from 0-12) can be used, it is really a combination of the PHQ-2 depression scale (described above) and the GAD-2 anxiety scale (from the parent GAD-7 anxiety scale).  Thus, another way to look at it is a 0-6 depression subscale and a 0-6 anxiety scale. It is clearly different than either the PHQ-9 or the PHQ-2

Note that these two references had different codes for the first question and that it was implemented at fhir.loinc.org as a decimal (not a choice), but academic references did not support that. -->

name: PainTracker Pain Location Body Diagram
title: PainTracker Pain Location Body Diagram
description: PainTracker Pain Location Body Diagram questionnaire. This is novel to the PainTracker system. It collects and reports body location(s) of pain (e.g. front left anterior lateral forearm), and a single body location for severe pain. It also reports a fibromyalgia score based on how many logical groups (eg right upper arm, and left lower leg) of these locations are selected.

code.display: PainTracker Pain Location Body Diagram

item.text: Below is a list of locations of pain. Please indicate one or more areas where you have felt pain over the past week.

item.text: Please state precisely where your severe pain is
